mdRecord.dcterms:title: William F. Holt House, exterior|general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Born on a farm in Mercer County, Missouri, in 1864, [William F.] Holt decided to strike out on his own at the age of 21, the same year he married Fannie Jones. Thirty-six years later, he sold his banking concerns in Missouri and Arizona and headed for Redlands. [work]

Once in Southern California, he applied his considerable business acumen to numerous enterprises. He began building the first railroad to the Imperial Valley, spurring the Southern Pacific Railroad to follow suit not long after. He also put together a telephone company and oversaw the completion of a telephone system throughout the Imperial Valley. He founded the towns of Holt, Brawley, and El Centro and established electric, gas and power companies in the Imperial Valley. -- http://www.webmediawire.com/news/20090409161644.html [work]
